field_edited_text.value:
82 Patarsco RivEr CROSSING

Roadway construction
a. Highway fills and grading.
b. Highway paving, guard rails and markers.
Toll booths and administration building.
Pier fenders.
Lighting.

The above work as shown on the Progress Chart, Plate 47, is shown as
being started by December 15, 1938 when the pedestals 1 to 26 under a
contract previously prepared in accordance with the engineering pro-
cedure hereinbefore described, can be started in order to be completed by
September 30, 1939. The construction of piers 1 to 14 inclusive, is begun in
pairs at one month intervals, starting with January 20, 1939 and completing
all piers by January 31, 1940. During this period piles would be in the course
of driving in 2 piers and other stages of construction would be in progress
on 4 piers simultaneously. The completion of substructure plans and
specifications, award of substructure contracts, approval of shop drawings
and the beginning of shop fabrication for the truss spans, cantilever units
and approach spans in Canton and Fairfield would be in simultaneous
progress as shown on the progress chart referred to above.

The estimates of cost of construction are based upon the necessary equip-
ment and labor requirements to insure the completion of the work in ac-
cordance with the schedule outlined above and shown on the chart.

The above construction procedure and the Progress Chart, Plate 47,
pertains to the use of a bridge crossing only. The Progress Chart and the
construction procedure for a tunnel would be entirely different and is not
herein presented.

ESTIMATED COST OF BRIDGE AND APPROACHES

The estimated cost of bridge and approaches is summarized in Table 28.
A. Preliminary Expenses

The preliminary expenses, herein listed, include all preliminary expenses
incurred or to be incurred by the State Roads Commission for surveys,
borings, traffic report, test piles, soil analysis for the determination of soil
mechanics of the sub-strata underlying the site of the bridge, preliminary
legal and administrative expenses. These preliminary expenses, with esti-
mates to cover all costs in connection therewith, are listed below. See
Table 29.
